Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk kcm_colors
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk kde-workspace
exit 0

function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk oxygen-cursor-themes
exit 0

exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: kde-workspace bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The kde-workspace packages consist of components providing the KDE graphical desktop environment. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, when attempting to assign the Meta+F8 keyboard shortcut to activate the Show Desktop Grid widget in KDE System Settings, KDE did not save this setting. As a consequence, it was not possible to assign Meta+F8 for Show Desktop Grid. A patch has been applied to fix this problem. Now, the setting is successfully saved after assigning Meta+F8 for Show Desktop Grid. (BZ#1040678) Previously, some properties in the X Resources feature, which is used by Tk applications, contained invalid color names. Consequently, Tk applications in KDE failed to launch, and the following error message was displayed: Application initialization failed: unknown color name "BACKGROUND". A patch has been applied to fix this bug, and Tk applications now launch correctly in KDE. (BZ#1043686) Previously, the Digital Clock widget allowed users to set Digital Clock to speak the time every minute even though this feature was not available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Consequently, Digital Clock showed the following error message: Starting Jovie Text-to-speech Service Failed. Could not found service "kttsd". With this update, the option to set Digital Clock to speak the time every minute has been removed, and Digital Clock now works as expected. (BZ#1060058) Prior to this update, when switching the KDE Calendar widget to a different calendar type in the Calendar System settings, the change did not take place immediately. Consequently, changing the calendar type did not show in KDE Calendar until the user switched to a different month. With this update, the problem has been fixed, and KDE Calendar now switches to a different calendar type without delay. (BZ#1090492) Previously, KDE did not handle the Active Screen Edge Actions feature correctly under certain circumstances on systems with multiple displays. Consequently, the specified screen edge was not activated when the cursor hovered over it. A patch has been applied to fix this problem, and the system now detects specified screen edges correctly even on systems with multiple displays. (BZ#1109936) Previously, on notebooks equipped with two batteries, KDE did not correctly boot when one of the batteries was low. As a consequence, when booting with one battery low but the other one sufficiently charged, KDE Power Manager displayed a warning that the battery level was critical, and the system entered hibernate mode. With this update, KDE considers additional batteries for power management. As a result, notebooks now boot correctly even if one of the batteries is low. (BZ#1109987) Users of kde-workspace are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
